newsitem.title: TAIWAN: Taiwan dollar closes litte changed.
newsitem.headline: Taiwan dollar closes litte changed.

text.p: The Taiwan dollar closed little changed against its U.S. counterpart on Monday and dealers said trading likely would remain balanced in the foreseable future.
The local unit ended at T$27.499 against Saturday's T$27.498 close. Turnover through dealers was a light US$160 million.
Dealers saw some demand for the greenback coming from local banks, but not enough to tip the equilibrium.
"Month-end demand for the U.S. dollar is not expected to be strong in November," said one dealer at a foreign bank.
Dealers expected a T$27.48-52 range in Tuesday trade.
